name: Circlemind
headline: Circlemind is an open-source RAG using knowledge graphs and PageRank.
description: Circlemind is developing the next-generation of memory systems for AI that surpasses current Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) methods. Our technology based on Knowledge Graphs and PageRank, allows for efficient, interpretable, and context-aware reasoning and retrieval.

founders.name: Antonio Vespoli, Founder
founders.description: Antonio is the co-founder and CEO of Circlemind. He holds a Master‚Äôs degree in Computing from Imperial College London, specializing in AI and Machine Learning. He spent three years as a Software Engineer at AWS, working on real-time streaming technology.

founders.name: Luca Pinchetti, Founder
founders.description: Luca is the co-founder and CTO of Circlemind. He holds a Master's degree in  Computer Science from the University of Oxford, where he researched alternative biologically-inspired methods to build neural networks for his PhD studies.

founders.name: Yuhang Song, Founder
founders.description: ü•∑ Yuhang was awarded J.P. Morgan AI Research Award, first-authored a Nature Neuroscience paper, cofounded Fractile, raised $15M in two years and exited.

![University of Oxford](https://cdn.durable.co/blocks/2dyt6sy5ktggWwIqPZyQ63TSGJjqC07h4H8ExQcAeJC0e5A3p4z7F69jlQ23VUIJ.png)
![Imperial College London](https://cdn.durable.co/blocks/ew3G4xM8fKdLyRDVHXJkNImfIgxnrQ7h8HBSboAXMMaoJC21sjazCpwdfhWYGKRi.png)
What makes us unique
## Promptable GraphRAG
```
Circlemind empowers you to create sophisticated RAG pipelines in plain English
```

Slide 1 of 5
Prev
Next
### Analyze these satellite images to identify and classify changes in land use in the San Francisco Bay Area. Specifically, detect new residential developments, changes in green spaces, and areas affected by wildfires. Focus on the timeline of these changes highlighting each type of land use transition.
### Analyze these transcripts of customer support phone conversations to identify common issues faced by our customers. Specifically, categorize the conversations into themes such as billing inquiries, product defects, and service outages. Focus on the frequency of each issue, customer sentiment, and any trends over time to inform potential improvements in customer service.
### Analyze these pediatric medical records to identify trends in childhood obesity among patients aged 2 to 12 years. Specifically, categorize the data by age group, gender, and socioeconomic status. Focus on changes in body mass index (BMI) over time, the prevalence of obesity-related health issues (like diabetes and hypertension), and the impact of recommended interventions. The goal is to inform targeted health programs and improve preventive care strategies.
### Analyze these classic fairy tales to identify recurring themes and character archetypes, such as the hero's journey, the presence of a mentor, and the transformation of the protagonist. Connect these stories with contemporary social issues, such as gender equality, environmentalism, or mental health.
### Analyze these online reviews for restaurants in New York City. Focus on identifying trends in customer sentiment related to food quality, service speed, and cleanliness. Highlight any correlations between these aspects and the overall star ratings, while also categorizing the reviews by cuisine type. Focus on aspects that would help potential customers make informed dining choices.
Our technology
## Vector Databases + Knowledge Graphs
```
You'll never need to build RAG from scratch again ‚Äî RAG that works amazingly out-of-the-box
```

![a close up of a blue and purple object](https://circlemind.co)
Always Self-Improving
Naive RAG uses static representations and does not evolve over time. **Our GraphRAG learns from every information and interaction**. It constantly re-arranges its memories to serve your specific use case as best as possible.
![gray round ball under blue sky during daytime](https://circlemind.co)
Multi-Hop Retrieval
Naive RAG fails to combine stored information effectively. Our GraphRAG can reason over memories and retrieve the most relevant information seamlessly.
![a bunch of different colored sprinkles on a pink background](https://circlemind.co)
Whole Dataset Reasoning
Naive RAG struggles with queries such as ‚Äútop 5 issues customers face.‚Äù Our GraphRAG understands your data in aggregate and answers these questions effectively.
![Circular motion of abstract neon particles](https://circlemind.co)
Dynamic Data
Naive RAG relies on static embeddings, which limit its ability to model information that evolve over time. In contrast, our GraphRAG can store evolving information, allowing for dynamic adaptation and improved context.
![Digital Brain With Colorful Fibers](https://circlemind.co)
Needle in a Haystack
Naive RAG struggles to capture the nuances of meaning. Our GraphRAG navigates its knowledge graph and finds the most appropriate information just like your brain does.
![Multi-colored programming language source code design example. Front view composition, on a dark blue surface with triangle grid pattern overlay and GUI.](https://circlemind.co)
Codebases
Naive RAG treats data as disjointed pieces, making it difficult to comprehend the overall structure. Our GraphRAG understands the interconnections between components.
## Frequently Asked Questions
```
Can't find what you're looking for? Don't hesitate to contact us for more information
```

What is Agentic RAG?
Agentic RAG is a framework that incorporates the concept of agents to enhance the capabilities and functionality of the retrieval pipeline. Circlemind uses agentic GraphRAG to analyze, understand, and retrieve your data as it best suits your specific use case.
What do you mean by promptable?
You can control Circlemind's graph construction by describing in English the type of data in use, the domain, the desired behaviour, examples of queries, and so on. Imagine Circlemind like an engineer on your team that will design and implement the best possible knowledge graph based on your descriptions and data.
Our AI will turn your words in a fully functional RAG system that works right out-of-the-box.
When should I use GraphRAG?
GraphRAG is particularly advantageous in scenarios involving domain-specific, dynamic information, such as evolving knowledge, and nuanced context retrieval. Our system outperforms naive RAG by up to 80% in accuracy in applications requiring deep data analysis, domain understanding, and integration of multiple data points. On the flip side, naive RAG is ideal for low-latency use cases involving mostly static data, and with no requirements for high-precision context retrieval.
How can I contact you?
You can reach us at **contact@circlemind.co**
## Pricing
Community Edition
Self-host our open-source package.
Free
[Get Started](https://circlemind.co/<https:/github.com/circlemind-ai/fast-graphrag/>)
Small or hobby projects
Self-hosted
Open-source
Popular
Business
Advanced features, premium support, and scalability to meet the needs of growing teams.
$300
per month
[Start now (100 free credits)](https://circlemind.co/<https:/app.circlemind.co>)
Fully managed
Graph visualizer and debugger
10,000 requests included
PDFs ingestion
Autoscaling
Unlimited graphs
Dedicated Slack channel
Enterprise
Flexible pricing that scales with your organization.
Custom
[Book a demo](https://circlemind.co/</demo>)
Data integrations (e.g. S3, Slack, Salesforce, etc)
White Glove Onboarding Call
VPC and On Prem Deployments
BAA Agreements
Zero Data Retention Agreements
SSO and SAML Authentication
## Don't waste time on RAG
```
Let our AI create the best solution for your use case, data, and questions
```

[Book a demo](https://circlemind.co/</demo>)
## [Circlemind](https://circlemind.co/</>)
San Francisco, California

generated_description:
## Circlemind: The Next Generation of AI Memory Systems

Founded in 2024 and backed by Y Combinator's Batch F24, Circlemind is an ambitious startup based in San Francisco, California, focusing on evolving Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) methods through open-source innovations. At its core, Circlemind leverages the power of Knowledge Graphs and PageRank to enable efficient, context-aware, and interpretable AI reasoning and retrieval.

### Mission and Vision

Circlemind's mission is simple yet profound: to develop a next-generation memory system for AI that goes beyond the limitations of current RAG methodologies. By adopting a unique approach that combines vector databases with knowledge graphs, Circlemind can create intelligent systems that adapt to user-specific contexts, data, and queries.

### What Makes Circlemind Unique?

The cornerstone of Circlemind's technology is what's known as **GraphRAG**, a highly adaptable retrieval framework. Unlike traditional static RAG approaches, Circlemind's system continuously learns and evolves based on new data and interactions. This self-improving capability allows it to provide more nuanced and relevant responses to complex queries. Here are some of the standout features:

- **Promptable GraphRAG**: Users can command the AI's graph construction in plain English, ensuring the technology aligns closely with the user's intent and data specifics.
- **Multi-Hop Retrieval**: The system can reason across a network of memories, retrieving highly relevant information seamlessly.
- **Whole Dataset Reasoning**: Capable of handling complex queries that require an aggregate understanding of data, unlike na√Øve RAG systems that may struggle with holistic insights.
- **Dynamic Data Adaptation**: GraphRAG excels with evolving information, making it ideal for applications that require updated context retrieval.

### Pricing and Accessibility

Circlemind aims to democratize access to advanced AI tools. They offer a **Community Edition** that is free for self-hosting, making it accessible for hobbyists and small projects. For businesses needing advanced features and support, there‚Äôs a subscription model priced at **$300 per month**. Custom enterprise solutions are also available, catering to scalable team needs.

### The Team

With a compact team of three, Circlemind's efforts are supported by a robust partnership with industry expert **Diana Hu**, who brings valuable insights from her experience in cutting-edge technology development. 

### Conclusion

Circlemind is positioned to push the boundaries of AI technology by harnessing the strengths of most modern systems while addressing their deficiencies. Their innovative approach could redefine how AI interacts with the vast amounts of information available today, allowing for more sophisticated and intuitive applications. For a closer look or to experiment with their offerings, check out their website at [Circlemind](https://circlemind.co) and don‚Äôt hesitate to **book a demo** or start with **100 free credits** to explore their capabilities firsthand. 

In a world that craves smarter AI solutions, Circlemind's advancements could very well chart a new path forward.
